Title: Bamboo Airways Scam
Full Review: Bamboo Airways uses every possible tactic to exploit money from foreign passengers by manipulating the name order between (Last Middle First) and (Last, First Middle), as seen in U.S. passports. For example, the traditional Vietnamese name (Last Middle First) “Tran Van Nam” becomes “Tran, Nam Van” in a U.S. passport (Last, First Middle). On September 25, 2024, despite all five of my family’s tickets being correctly registered as “Tran, Nam Van,” matching our U.S. passports, Bamboo Airways still created an issue, claiming the names were incorrect and demanding a fine for all five tickets. They attempted to delay us so we would miss our flight, pressuring us to pay the fine to board on time. As you can see, many Bamboo Airways passengers have been scammed in this way. I hope the government will act justly and scrutinize these deceptive tactics used by Bamboo Airways. I am truly ashamed of the airline’s unethical practices.

Title: Flight cancelled. Yet to recieve refund. Nightmare chasing refund.
Full Review:
I booked a Sydney to Ho Chi Minh return. The flight back to Sydney was cancelled out right. I emaildled twice to get refund ... no response. When leaving Sydney (flight out of Sydney not cancelled) I went to Bamboo Airways desk to arrange for refund if return flight. They said they did not process refunds but recommended that I find the Bamboo Airways ticketing desk in Ho Chi Minh airport where a refund would be given. I found the Bamboo Airways desk at Ho Chi Minh and even though I could give them all documentation, emails and the mastercard for refund they refused to refund the ticket saying it wasnt their Policy to refund at that desk and I had to wait for response via email. Its been about a month now and this response has not yet come. I see via Bamboos Facebook page that they are niw wanting people to fill in a form for a refund. 

It shouldnt be this hard to get a refund for a cancelled flight. 

The flight that did run from Sydney to Ho Chi Minh was actually good. It ran on time and there was a good food and beverage service. Seats were comfortable. The plane was half empty. 

Unfortunately the cancellation of services and inability to secure refund (to date) has meant that even though the flight I did take was good, I wouldnt fly with Bamboo Airways again.

Title: Terrible service - avoid
Full Review: Booked a two week, return flight, from UK to Vietnam. Bamboo changed the return flight twice; the last change was done the day we drove to the airport ahead of our early morning flight. They ‘pulled’ our flight and bumped us to another date we couldn’t make. The new date made our trip  17/18 days long, which meant finding new accommodation and having extra food/drink costs. We also couldn’t make the new date due to work (I’m a Dr). But you can’t cancel the flight online; in fact you can’t do anything online. An hour before leaving the house I had to try calling their call centre in Vietnam. It took 6 goes to get through without being cut off. I asked for a cancellation and refund on the return element of the ticket (to book with another airline) but they insisted they wanted to put us on another flight of theirs rather than refund us. I was worried about the phone being cut off again, and I felt we were put on the spot, so we reluctantly agreed to take an earlier flight home meaning it cut 4 days off our trip. This also meant we had to rebook our internal travel (change hotels and rebook internal flights). Iv been told that because they changed our return flight before 14 days I can’t claim my additional costs or costs incurred with things I couldn’t use. I discovered afterward that if I’d have taken the later flight they’d have covered my additional costs but not for the earlier flight! So I lost 4 days of my holiday and booked things we couldn’t do, because we had to be back at a specific time.  Aside from this, you can’t even book your meal online so I had no veggie food. Ridiculous in this day and age! Hanoi airport was utter chaos, and the Bomboo desk took forever to check us in (as you can’t check in on line either!). There were other issues such as closed loos, no toilet paper, and hardly any drinks. I could go on but .... just avoid  avoid avoid.

Title: Pretty good
Full Review: I was flying to Melbourne from Hanoi in Bamboo Airways. First that flight was full so they checked our bags (they only check our bags because the flight was full, not for taking more money from passengers like budget airlines). The boarding was a bit long but I got into the plane. That day I flew the economy class. The legroom was pretty good so I give it a 9.5/10. The containing suitcase was spacious so I give it a 10/10. The flight was on time. The screen was exceptional with sensitive screen and lots of Vietnamese shows. But there are still some English shows. I give it an 8.25/10 because the map is not very detailed. The seat can recline but doesn't recline much and it isn't very comfortable. So it gets 7.75/10. I recommend you to bring a pillow if you fly long-haul trips. The airplane is a bit dirty at the corners. I think that they were rushing to prepare for the my flight. Gets 7.5/10. The restroom is very clean and neat with some air refresher. The water was working and soap is very fragant. Bamboo Airways gets full marks on restroom. The pilot speaks Engligh very fluently, so I can understand. After the plane reached its crusing altitude, they started to serve dinner. I chose some potatoes and some fishes. The food was a bit dissapointing. So the airline got a 7/10 on food. After over 9 hours of flying we landed in Melbourne ON TIME. In my opinion, the on time is a thing that a lot of Western airlines can't do but Vietnam's can. Its pretty good, if you want to fly from place to place.

Title: One of the worst airlines that I have travelled in
Full Review: They misplaced our luggage on our flight to HCMC from Melbourne. We were without the luggage for the entire trip of 8 days and there was no earnest attempt made to locate and deliver our luggage in the next available flight. Instead they decided to keep the luggage in Melbourne to save them the transportation costs. In spite of several emails, I did not receive any communication until the last day of my return. For all the inconvenience and additional expenses incurred on the essentials, we were offered a paltry compensation of $60. It was more an insult than a compensation and hence, I did not accept the compensation. Apparently, that is their policy. As per Montreal convention, which Vietnam is part of, airlines are required to compensate customers for baggage delays with up to $1700 USD. They are misleading people stating that their company policy allows them to compensate up to a maximum of $30 only. They turned our holiday into a nightmare as we had to shop for essentials including basic clothes for three of us, which included a 3 year old toddler. We spent over $1700 in essentials and $60 does not even remotely make up for it. Imagine spending time shopping in an alien country with a toddler when we should have been enjoying our holiday. Not just money but I Iost precious time because of this airlines. Never will I ever fly with Bamboo Airways.

Title: Ridiculous scam-like "policy". Bamboo must be short for Bamboozle
Full Review:
My wife booked 2 tickets for us to travel from Saigon to Hanoi on booking.com. We checked-in online without issue, but had to check-in baggage when we got to the airport. The service rep said that we could not proceed because my wife had left our middle names off the tickets and that we would have to go to another counter to correct the issue. Seemed odd to us since we have traveled without issue on other airlines when we didn't include our middle names. We got to the other counter and was told that 1) my name on my ticket didn't need to be corrected because I have a U.S. passport (my wife has a Vietnamese passport), 2) they could not correct my wife's name on her ticket because she booked through booking.com and not Bamboo directly, however, if she could show a Vietnamese ID other than her passport, they could make the change. Since my wife didn't have any other Vietnamese ID, she was told her only option was to purchase a brand new ticket, which she ended up doing.  We were then issued new tickets which were different seats than what we originally had.  We originally had seats at row 17, window and middle. They moved us to row 36 (2nd to last row), middle and aisle.

Seats didn't have the worst leg room I've experienced, but it wasn't that much better. Seats are very uncomfortable as there is minimal cushioning.

Lunch was an absolute joke. Initially, it looked like a mini-baguette-like bread that was cut in half, but it was actually, in fact, a sandwich if you can even call it that. It consisted of a hot dog that came straight out of the packaging (not heated or cooked in any sort of way), a stem of cilantro, and some measly pieces of pork/chicken floss (chà bông) (not even sure what meat it was). I would almost have preferred just a piece of bread than them passing this off as a sandwich.

Many of the passengers also seem to be those that rarely travel as they don't respect lines, personal space, or instructions given by staff. When lining up to board the plane, some older ladies literally squeezed themselves in front of us. When my wife called them out on it in Vietnamese saying that there's a line and they can't just cut in front, they just replied back in Vietnamese that "it's no big deal" (Có gì đâu). Passengers seated in front of us kept resting their arms/hands on top of their headrest which draped their hands onto our side resulting in us having to look at fingernails caked with dirt/oil/etc... while we were eating our embarrassment of a lunch. Passengers were repeatedly instructed to sit down while the seat belt light was on during turbulence, but they often just ignored the instructions.

Title: Was nicely surprised
Full Review: Originally was supposed to be on Vietnam Airlines but was transferred to Bamboo whom I’d never heard of so was worried, have to admit was nicely surprised of the service. Managed to get extra legroom for free too when checked in. Not a brilliant choice of films but managed to watch some that not seen before. Return flight was a night flight and was given water within half an hour of take off, food served about an hour into the flight and was offered wine as well as beer and soft drinks, came round to top your drinks up as well. Sandwiches were brought round to those who were awake half way through the flight then another meal 90 minutes before landing. Upgraded to premium economy on the return journey for £80 at the airport and was very pleased with the seat which had plenty of room, leg rests and a great recline. Movies were better on the return journey too.all in all a great service and wouldn’t hesitate to fly with them again.

Title: Surprised by such good service
Full Review:
Recently flew Bamboo from Gatwick to Hanoi and our return leg was Saigon to Gatwick.  When the travel company we were using notified us that our airline was changing fro Vietnam Airways to Bamboo, I’ll be honest, I was not happy.  Who were Bamboo Airlines???? 

We arrived  at Gatwick and managed to upgrade to Business (never flown Business before) so was rather excited at the prospect of lots of leg room.  Even though we upgraded at the airport (so cheaper) we got lounge entry and premium security included which was good.  The lounge was just the normal No.1 lounge so nothing special there but it done the job (Club lounge was closed so don’t know if that would have been used normally).

We were given priority boarding and shown to our seats, nice touch.  

Our seats went into beds, nice sized tv, nice amenities bag (with toothbrush, hand sanitiser, eye mask etc), plenty of space and well positioned so you can’t really see anyone else. Hubby & I had seats in the centre so we could talk (just left the middle screen open).  

The service was excellent and so was the food, so much food! I had wine going out but on our return journey I had fizz (it wasn’t on offer going out).  

The beds were comfortable and I actually managed to sleep (which I’m not usually able to do) the blankets were lovely and soft and the pillow was good as well.  

I liked the space you got, I’m not 100% comfortable flying but found that not being cramped really helped.  

Our return journey (managed to upgrade again) was just as good, lounge at Saigon a bit nicer than Gatwick.

Hubby managed to leave his phone in the lounge, he told a member of the cabin crew and they got the phone back to us before take-off so very impressed with the service we received.

All in all I would recommend Bamboo Business Class,

Title: Poor experience
Full Review:
I flew with bamboo from Gatwick to Hanoi then back from Saigon to Gatwick. 

I’m comparing my experience to previous flights with Thai airways and Eva air. 

There was no option to select dietary requirements on booking, I had to email customer service but they got the food wrong on both flights, after the outbound flight I emailed them about the mistake, the day of the return flight they tried to tell me they need 24 hours notice and I’d have to bring my own food. I told them I emailed them multiple times with plenty of notice, I then got an email saying they would meet my requirements. 
On the plane the stewards told me there was no special meal request, even though it was confirmed at check in. Made me find the emails to ‘prove’ it then magically my food appeared. 

I like to have a couple of drinks on a long flight like that, I was given one small can of beer on the outbound flight, then when I asked for another I was told it was ‘finished’ 
Return flight no alcoholic drinks were offered to anyone. 

The seats feel smaller than normal long haul economy but maybe that’s in my head as the planes were full. 

You have no individual air conditioning controls and it was uncomfortably hot. 

The windows get closed after take off and the controls are locked so you can’t open them. Why? I like to look out the window, you just feel like you’re trapped in a hot capsule for 12 hours.

Entertainment wasn’t great. 

I would avoid if you have other options.

First, we took flight QH 241 from Hanoi to Ho Chi Minh City. At the check-in in Noibai airport, Bamboo's staff checked and confirmed that there was 90kg of checked baggage to Ho Chi Minh City. Then we  flew to Ho chi Minh City  and did check-in procedures in Ho Chi Minh City to take flight QH 086 to Sydney. At the check-in counter, the check-in peson said that our checked baggage was 8kg overweight and had to be paid extra, although he also admitted that the total amount of checked baggage from Hanoi was 90kg according to tags on baggaged attached by Bamboo staff in Noibai airport. This is clearly a mistake of the Bamboo airline, due to the incorrect weighing of baggage check at Noi Bai or Saigon airports, or because the staff at Noi Bai were negligent in weighing. However, when we asked to speak to the supervisor in charge, he said that we need to complain to Noi Bai airport, or not be able to board the plane, or have to pay more.
We were very surprised at the unreasonable behavior of Bamboo's staff and the supervisor in charge of check-in at Tan Son Nhat airport. They behaved irresponsibly, as if the check-in department at Noi Bai was not a unit of Bamboo. Recently, my family has used Bamboo Airways' services a few times and is quite satisfied with the quality of service provided by the airline. However, the recent incident has changed our feelings for Bamboo. It is hoped that Bamboo Airways will take timely corrective measures to avoid such phenomena, worsening the good reputation and image that the airline has worked so hard to cultivate.

Title: Never again. Ryanair style airline which is unacceptable on a 14h flight.
Full Review: Never again. Bamboo Airways does not allow online check in for international flights. We spent over 2 hours queuing at the airport in Hanoi to check in and drop our bags. This is horrendous. No email communication from Bamboo Airways prior to departure (booked our flights via a travel agent) and they changed departure time less than 24h prior to departure. They are very proud of flying Boeing 787 Dreamliner but they saved on any interior features and so the seats are not comfortable, there is no individual control over air-conditioning, they lock all windows so you will not see anything outside during the whole duration of the flights. There is very very very poor choice of inflight entertainment and they have the same movies/ series on the flight London to and from Hanoi. We were served dinner before being served any drinks. On the plus side, the food you get is passable and some staff members are kind and friendly. The flight arrived on time despite leaving (on both occasions) late.

Title: A great experience yet again ( Business Class )
Full Review:
Check-in : At the dedicated Business Class counter. A standard experience , but the staff member did make the effort to let us know about the fast-track at security / lounge location / etc.

Security : As mentioned above , there is a separate Fast-Track for Business Class passengers , which was quite beneficial at that time of the day.

Lounge : There is a separate lounge for Bamboo Airways , with ample seating. Did not pay much attention to the F&B options available , but the lounge was plush & comfortable enough for a short stay.

Boarding : Unlike Hanoi , we did not notice / experience the "escort-to-gate-from-lounge" service here. At the gate / aerobridge , the ground staff genuinely treat you like a VIP , and inform the cabin crew about your arrival.

Seating / Layout : Standard Business Class seats , in 2-2 configuration. Comfortable enough , but nothing exceptional.

Service : Very professional & courteous crew.

Food & Beverage : A sandwich ( a.k.a. a snack ) , presented nicely on a tray ( despite being a morning / breakfast time flight ). The Vietnamese Iced Coffee was delightful.

Arrival : Private van transfer to the terminal. Luggage arrived on a priority basis , even before rest of the passengers reached the terminal.

Title: Great value for money - no delays, standard food, free check-in 20kg baggage
Full Review:
Pleasant surprise. I read quite some bad reviews from published article. I guess it was reported as bad delays due to covid restriction period. I booked through Trip.com.
Our Flight is scheduled 8.30am to depart, actual departure about 8.40am (which is normal delay for all airlines, due to normal logistics/admin checks). 
Happy that we arrived 14 minutes earlier anyway, at 12.41 pm into Singapore, (scheduled arrival was 12.55pm). 
Food is standard and fine, enough to fill you, a western fish option and an asian Chicken on Rice. Most of the service crew staff are friendly. Except one who was abit impatient trying to stop me from rearranging my luggage near taking off. One thing i noted, the toilet, is clean (i used at beginning of the flight), but the sink did not seem to drain the water well, after washing my hands. I highlighted to the service crew who told me he will fix it. 
In addition, I heard a mother with a crying baby for quite some time, seated behind me, which i thought the Service Crew could have taken initiative to come to see how they could help. 
Generally, if you want to arrive safe, punctual, at affordable price ( i paid $83 for airfare + $67 tax = Total $151 for 1 leg back via Trip.com), clean flight with basic food, yet able to have a free 20kg checked-in baggage, I highly recommend this airline ! I'll surely take it again.

Title: A true boutique airline ( Business Class )
Full Review:
Check-in : Not quite ideal to be frank. We arrived late at night in Vietnam , and were expecting a baggage drop-off counter in T2 itself , but there wasn't any. When we reached T1 , the staff refused to check us in. Reason : our flight was technically departing the next day ( i.e. first flight of the day ) & departures in the domestic terminal cease for the night , thus , we were very curtly told to come 2 hours before our flight. The attitude of the staff could have easily been friendlier / more effort could have been made to explain things despite the language barrier , especially to a family of 4 foreigners flying in their Business Class. 

Security : Did not notice any separate queue for Business Class passengers , nor were we told about it at the check-in counter. But being the very first passengers of the day made all that immaterial.

Lounge : Now this is where everything took a turn for the better. Staff - FABULOUS. Food - AMAZING. Service - PAR EXCELLENCE. We were treated by the staff as if we're in their own home , and were pampered with all the local delicacies. Do try the Pho here.

Boarding : Just when we thought we've seen the best the airline could offer , came the 'luxurious' boarding experience. WOW. First , a ground staff member came to personally escort us all the way to the gate. Since our aircraft was at a remote parking bay , we got a private car to drive us down the tarmac. Once at the aircraft , the ground staff & crew treat you like a VIP , and the latter even load your luggage in the overhead bins.

Seating / Layout : The seats are pretty basic , but thankfully not the bulky kind as seen in older aircrafts. 2-2 configuration arranged in 4 rows.

Service : VERY GOOD. The crew was attentive , courteous & professional.

Food & Beverage : Not a breakfast spread. More of a snack to be honest. But , well presented. The Vietnamese cold coffee was delightful.

Arrival : The crew waited for us to exit the aerobridge , before the others were allowed to disembark. Our luggage pieces were the 1st to arrive i.e. 'Priority' was followed

I have no idea why it takes so long just to check some basic documents like vaccine certifactes etc.

The flight attendants were slightly friendlier. All we got was water and a HORRIBLE sandwhich though. Also no other food on offer like on AirAsia for example ... 

Needless to say there was also a delay of around 45 minutes...Didn't surprise me at all considering what I experienced during check in.

Title: You get what you pay for, I wish we had paid more!
Full Review:
I really has high hopes for this airline. Their website looks encouraging and I was looking forward to flying with them. Booking was relatively easy and the price was very reasonable, thats where the positives end. 

We’d paid extra for extra legroom seats and priority boarding. Priority boarding didn’t exist and the extra legroom seats were almost immediately filled by passengers moving from their allotted standard seats. We’d have actually had more room had we moved to a now empty row near the back. Flight attendants do very little to enforce rules which gives me great concern. During the takeoff roll one passenger spoke loudly on his mobile while another got up, moved seats and lay across a row of three with no seatbelt on. Similarly the fasten seatbelt sign is neither obeyed nor enforced. Who knows what else is ignored behind the scenes. 

The refreshment service was cancelled “due to virus” and crew disappeared behind the curtains for the duration. 

Unfortunately we have another flight booked with this outfit but I’m considering writing off the ticket cost and rebooking with VN. 

I was previously pleased to see they have ambition to start flights to Europe, I’m not sure this will ever happen, how can they expect to pass muster with the EU flight safety standards? A real shame and missed opportunity for what had potential to be a great new startup.

Title: New airline with extremely poor customer service
Full Review:
This airline only commenced in Jan 2019 and already they are not doing themselves any favor with their current front desk crew. First time flying with them, one word to describe my first impression - chaos. Absolute chaos. The staff "directing" the queue didn't let anyone know where to line up, she just lifted the barrier and let around 5 people go through and let us figured out ourselves which counter to line up at. Most of the counters at that point already had 4 or more people waiting. 
The staff at the check-in desk was borderline rude in his tone and the way he addressed us. For example, he asked for passport using this exact phrase "where's passport and travel documents?".. no pronouns- not even looking up. We conversed in Vietnamese, so really, he got no excuse of not knowing how to use basic polite phrases- especially when he is supposedly in a "customer service" role.
Again when he asked about luggages, "what's this, checked in or carry on?". 
Did this person missed basic customer service training when he started this job?
I have flown with other budget airlines before, eg., Vietjet, Jetstar, etc. and I know they're not known for their exceptional customer service but at least it's passable. This airline made me feel they have gone really backward with their approach. For a brand new airline shouldn't they be trying extra hard to win customer over with their customer service?
Next time, I'll pay the extra 1 or 2 AUD and fly with Vietjet. Gave them a try but not up to standard, even for a budget airline.

Full Review:

The first payment failed.
The second attempt worked.

Absolutely annoying.

Asking for help, I was told the change would be an amount coming to 95% of the flight fare.

Fair enough.
So I tried to change my name online and pay the fee. Guess what?

Title: Fresh and fast developing airline
Full Review: For the first time with this new airline I flew Hanoi-Hue 5th January on an A320-200. Purchase online was easy and very clear without any hidden costs. A minor reschedule was clearly informed (and adjustable) weeks before departure. The airline is already very popular in Vietnam and grows quickly. Checked in smooth though long queues despite 10 counters were open. Had to wait some 40 Minutes to be checked in. Got offered any seat and chose an exit seat as flight was only half full. No issue with luggage like for other low cost carriers, especially the Vietjetair that troubles many passengers due to extremely strict luggage policies with several checks in airports. Onboard, 4 FAs and 2 “service attendants” easily took care of the 80 passengers. The FAs were all Turkish women while the SAs were Vietnamese and acted mainly as translators. Nice international touch. Given water, tissue, magazines. I brought my own coffee sachets to get expresso onboard. 8 business class seats were empty. Flight on time. Busgating in both ends. Extremely good value for money, paid 33 USD. Attendant were very talkative and extrovert. No IFE on board but no need as flight took only 70 Minutes. Bamboo Airways have their logos and branding everywhere onboard with nice decorations and new uniforms etc. Even the drinking water were produced, labelled and marketed by the airline. Bamboo is considered as an LCC carrier but compares at least to a 3-star legacy carrier. A meal or at least a snack would have been nice but hard to claim for the price paid. Will fly again a.s.a.p.

Title: Shame!!! I felt not an equal passenger as the others!!!
Full Review:
My title sounds somehow a little bit heavy but i will try to explain as thoroughly as I can. For sure this flight that was done today 23rd of December ruined my mood and my whole first day in Da Nang.
I booked this flight QH 107 from Hanoi to Da Nang around 2 months ago. I checked the profile of the company and everything that has to do on the flight as to be ok and informed about anything. Althought i saw some bad reviews and knew that is a low budget company I gave a try since it was a domestic flight and all the options were more or less the same. But the things that made me choose this one was the new planes and some other very good reviews.
To let everyone know this was my 160th flight in my life and the 50th country that I visit till now and it was the first time that i felt so bad,unequal and like a stranger that was given a favour to fly.
Some bad issues started before the flight when i informed that i need to change my flight schedule as the company decided to change the time. So i loged in their site but for 2 days they didnt let me to change my option. After several messages and calls which are not cheap from my country finally they change it.
Their check in is very primitive as it took a lot of time to check the already checked in tickets and to pass the luggage.
I skipped all of these in my mind and when we entered with my girlfriend we were so happy and surprised of the new type of aircraft, the spacious legroom, the beautiful dressing of the flight attendants and ofcourse the snack in so small flight. But from here starts all the bad things...
First of all to mention that we were placed in a row without any window due to random web check in which not allow you to change seat although when we entered we realised that there were about 30 seats available and many of them whole rows with windows. Now it comes the great moment. I noticed many locals (which i want to mention were in social media during take off and landing and noone tell them anything, came inside the aircraft with beers and juices etc) and ofcourse changing seats either by themselves or others asking the flight attendants. I didnt see anyone to be stopped to change seat. I have also changed seats in many flights if there are free.
So i kindly also asked if i can change seat in order to have window. The answer I received by word is yes you can change but during landing you need to come back to your seat. Sounds very weird and never heard this again. All the others that changed seats didnt returned to their previous seats during landing.
Before we start the procedure of landing I asked again kindly if i can change seat as to see the landing. The answer that I received was no you can not and when i say that many changed before me she responded that you should have done it before. But I ask to do it and the answer was weird as I wrote. Maybe because I am a tourist.
To sum on and sorry for the long review, this behaviour ruined the excellent review I was ready to write, I will definitely not use this company again and I strongly recommend anyone not even thing to travel. There are plenty choices for domestic flights in Vietnam.

Title: Pleasant but inconsistent experience
Full Review:
We booked a round trip HAN-SGN-DAD-HAN for three people in Business and were happy overall despite several areas can be improved.
The Good:
1. The Business counters were ready to accept us at all airports without any wait etc.
2. The best experience was at HAN check-in: we were escorted all the ways from the check-in desk, (Priority) security, Lounge, gate and aircraft. Wonderful! This could be very useful for people who are not familiar with navigating around the airports!
3. The HAN lounge (Song Hong) was the best comparing to the ones at SGN or DAD. Song Hong lounge had good selections of foods, snacks and beverages despite our departure in the early morning.
4. All staff were very polite and professional with good grasp of English.

Things can be improved:
1. Our outbound flight (HAN-SGN) was originally due to depart around midday but changed at less than 24 hours with the reason that the flight was cancelled.We were re-booked to the earliest flight (around 6:00AM) of the same day. Later on we found out that the original flight was not canceled and that led us to believe someones more important wanted to fly midday and we were moved to accommodate the change!
2. We were quite lucky to use an agent to handle all logistic as opposed to do that directly with the airlines. It was quite a challenge to find relevant information from Bamboo's website or contact - we were not able to find details but able to obtain the information from our booking agent! We were not able to check in online despite attempts to do that for every leg - The website always returned error to the effect that the information was invalid! it appeared it was only possible to check in at an airport counter.
3. The check-in experience at HAN was an excellent exception: no escorts at SGN nor DAD! At SGN we were not able to check in due to we were 3 hour 20 minutes before departure time despite contacting the helpdesk at the airport - we were told that the system were not ready then.

All in all, we are very glad to travel on Bamboo Airways in business class. Hopefully, the airlines will be able to improve the experience further and we will be more than willing to use Bamboo again.

Title: Constant delays with dishonest answers
Full Review:
On the morning of 11 August, I was informed that my Bamboo airlines flight at 8:00PM Gad been changed to 10:50PM, When I telephoned the airline to ask about that, they said it was due to bad weather.

I am a maritime expert, and was a private pilot for 3 years. I checked to Da Nang and Hanoi weather (as I do for voyage and flight planning) and there was no bad weather, forecast for this day. Additionally, I checked vietnam Airlines, Vietjet, and JetStar, and none of them had any delays due to weather for their flights departing Da Nang for Hanoi, that evening. 

When I called Bamboo, they said it was for weather and safety. Additionally, I learned that the airline will refund money for flights departing 3 hours or more, past their scheduled departure time (they made sure that the flight would depart 2 hours and 50 minutes late; too convenient for them). 

This is the worst customer service and worst bad excuse, I have encountered in the airline business, and I have flown extensively, to 111 countries!! Other airlines flying the same route, had system-operations delays for those Departure and arrival slots on that route; no weather delays. 

If you don’t want to be lied to, don’t fly Bamboo airlines.
